utterances: The Hallmark Channel is doing a series of crossword mysteries that involves a crossword editor at a New York newspaper who is involved with solving a murder mystery.
I just have a cameo or a small part.
I'm going to be playing table tennis in a park.
So you get to show off your famous table tennis moves?
(Laughter) Just a little bit, maybe for a second.
All right, Will, go ahead and remind us of last week's puzzle challenge.
It came from listener Dominic Telvaquio (ph) of Chicago.
And it was a real nice one.
I said think of a well-known musician whose last name contains a body part.
The musician has a single-word nickname that anagrams to a different body part.
Who's the musician, and what's the nickname?
Well, the musician is Louis Armstrong which, of course, contains arm.
His nickname was Satchmo, which is an anagram of stomach.
I should tell you, well, my husband managed to get that within seconds while I was still just trying to think of any musician with a nickname.
But we did have more than 1,500 correct responses.
This week's winner is Mark Nolan, who hails from Avon, Conn.
You've been filling your retirement with travel, as I understand it.
Well, three years ago, my wife and I sold our home in Connecticut.
And we've been on the road ever since.
We've been in 30 countries and four continents.
Currently, we're in Santa Barbara for a couple of months.
I would say the Dolomites in the Italian Alps - Northern Italy - and the Maldives.
What's your favorite part about traveling?
Without a doubt, the best part has been the many incredible people that we've met.
We've made a lot of friends all over the world.
Are you ready to play The Puzzle?
OK - as ready as you're going to be.
All right, Mark and Melissa, I'm going to read you some sentences leaving off the last two words.
Add an L at the front of the first word.
And phonetically, you'll get the second word, which completes the sentence.
For example, if you drive about 30 miles up the coast from Boston, you'll wind up blank blank.
You would wind up in Lynn.
I will sell my buildings in the Midwest, South and West, but I want my buildings in the blank blank.
We're looking for a direction, I'm thinking.
And it's not Midwest, South or West.
And put an L in front of that.
Given the Endangered Species Act, is killing a bald blank blank?
Is killing a bald eagle legal?
While others at the potluck supper created orange and lemon juice drinks, blank blank.
And the first blank here itself has two words.
What's a juice drink that's not orange or lemon?
Now, what would the lime juice be?
And you got the whole thing.
